Description: Three berbers, to left a man seated close to a small stove, on the outside of an Ancient Egyptian building near a large column, wearing robes, a turban, a scarf and shoes, plays a stringed instrument ('kisirka') to two young women standing to right, both barefoot and wearing bangles, one of them has her head covered, wears a robe, shawl and an ankle bangle, and holds a jug, while the other, leaning on her companion, has her head uncovered, her left breast exposed, and wears pantaloons, a shawl and necklaces; after Prisse D'Avennes; illustration to 'Oriental Album: Characters, Costumes, and Modes of Life in the Valley of the Nile', with text by James Augustus St John and illustrations by E. Prisse [Prisse D'Avennes], London: James Madden, 1848 Lithograph with one tint-stone
Producer name: After: Achille Émile Théodore Prisse D'Avennes
Curator's comments: The 'Oriental Album' is in the Department of Prints and Drawings.
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (72)
Associated names: Illustration to: James Augustus St John
Associated titles: Oriental Album: Characters, Costumes, and Modes of Life in the Valley of the Nile
